description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Today we’re announcing <a href="https://get.page">.page</a>, the newest top-level domain (TLD) from <a href="https://www.registry.google/">Google Registry</a>.<br/></p><p>A TLD is the last part of a domain name, like .com in “<a href="http://www.google.com">google.com</a>” or .google in “<a href="https://blog.google">blog.google</a>” (the site you’re on right now). The .page TLD is a new opportunity for anyone to build an online presence. Whether you’re writing a blog, getting your business online, or promoting your latest project, .page makes it simple and more secure to get the word out about the unique things you do. <br/></p><p><br/>Check out 10 interesting things some people and businesses are already doing on .page:<br/><br/></p><ol><li><a href="https://ellen.page">Ellen.Page</a> is the website of Academy Award®-nominated actress and producer Ellen Page that will spotlight LGBTQ culture and social causes.<a href="https://ellen.page"><br/></a></li><li><a href="https://home.page">Home.Page</a> is a project by the digital media artist Aaron Koblin, who is creating a living collection of hand-drawn houses from people across the world. Enjoy free art daily and help bring real people home by supporting revolving bail.<br/></li><li><a href="https://christophniemann.page">ChristophNiemann.Page</a> is the virtual exhibition space of illustrator, graphic designer, and author Christoph Niemann.<br/></li><li><a href="https://web.page">Web.Page</a> is a collaboration between a group of designers and developers who will offer a monthly online magazine with design techniques, strategies, and inspiration. <br/></li><li><a href="https://careerxo.page/">CareerXO.Page</a> by Geek Girl Careers is a personality assessment designed to help women find tech careers they love.<br/></li><li><a href="https://turnthe.page">TurnThe.Page</a> by Insurance Lounge offers advice about the transition from career to retirement.<br/></li><li><a href="https://www.wordasimage.page">WordAsImage.Page</a> is a project by designer Ji Lee that explores the visualizations of words through typography.<br/></li><li><a href="https://membrane.page">Membrane.Page</a> by Synder Filtration is an educational website about spiral-wound nanofiltration, ultrafiltration, and microfiltration membrane elements and systems.<br/></li><li><a href="https://tv.page">TV.Page</a> is a SaaS company that provides shoppable video technology for ecommerce, social media, and retail stores.<br/></li><li><a href="https://navlekha.page/">Navlekha.Page</a> was created by <a href="https://navlekha.withgoogle.com">Navlekhā</a>, a Google initiative that helps Indian publishers get their content online with free authoring tools, guidance, and a .page domain for the first 3 years. Since the initiative debuted at <a href="https://www.blog.google/technology/next-billion-users/google-for-india-2018/">Google for India</a>, publishers are creating articles within minutes. And Navlekhā plans to bring 135,000 publishers online over the next 5 years.<br/></li></ol></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Security is a top priority for Google Registry’s domains. To help keep your information safe, all .page websites require an SSL certificate, which helps keep connections to your domain secure and helps protect against things like ad malware and tracking injections. Both .page and <a href="https://www.blog.google/technology/developers/introducing-app-more-secure-home-apps-web/">.app</a>, which we launched in May, will help move the web to an <a href="https://security.googleblog.com/2018/02/a-secure-web-is-here-to-stay.html">HTTPS-everywhere</a> future.<br/></p><p>.page domains are available now through the Early Access Program. For an extra fee, you’ll have the chance to get the perfect .page domain name from participating registrar partners before standard registrations become available on October 9th. For more details about registering your domain, check out <a href="https://get.page">get.page</a>. We’re looking forward to seeing what you’ll build on .page!<br/></p></div></div></body></html>
title: Start a new .page today

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><br/><p>“Engineers are boys.”</p><p>What do you do when your 4 year-old daughter proclaims this? Start a passion project, collaborate with your peers, and publish a children’s picture book to bust that bias.</p><p>I wrote “Ara the Star Engineer” to inspire young kids to explore the magic of STEM. And it took a village to do it. Along with many other Googlers who shared my determination, we came up with an inspiring, inclusive and whimsical way to learn about computers and technology from real-life Google trailblazers of diverse backgrounds: Diane Tang, Marian Croak, Parisa Tabriz and Kripa Krishnan.</p><p>“Ara the Star Engineer” will be released on October 11, in celebration of the International Day of the Girl Child, and book sales proceeds will be donated to STEM nonprofits. <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bcVA-07VfOs&amp;feature=youtu.be">Check out the trailer</a> and preorder the book at <a href="http://www.arastarengineer.com">www.arastarengineer.com</a>.</p></div></div></body></html>
title: Ara The Star Engineer, a STEM book on a mission

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Everyone can benefit from hands-free support when using technology, but for the <a href="https://accessibility.gtri.gatech.edu/assistant/acc_info/factsheet_dexterity_mobility.php">62 million people</a> in the U.S. with motor and mobility impairments, it can be a vital requirement. For <a href="https://www.platinumperformance.com/articles/stefanie-putnam">Stefanie Putnam</a>, a quadriplegic and a para-equestrian driver, tasks like taking photos, sending texts and composing emails could be daunting.</p><p>Stefanie was one of several people the <a href="https://www.google.com/accessibility/">Google Accessibility team</a> worked with to test early prototypes of a feature which allowed people to control their Android device using voice-only commands. Her feedback—and that of other testers—was instructional in shaping a new product we’ve just released called Voice Access.</p><p>“After using this product for probably about 10 seconds, I think I’m falling in love with it,” said Stefanie. “You use your voice and you’re able to access the world. It has become a huge staple in my life.”</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Stefanie Putnam testing Voice Access" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/Screen_Shot_2018-09-27_at_10.13.43_AM.max-1000x1000.png"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>Stefanie Putnam testing Voice Access</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p><a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.accessibility.voiceaccess&amp;e=-EnableAppDetailsPageRedesign">Voice Access</a> provides a hands-free experience for Android, letting people navigate through apps, compose and edit text, and talk to the Google Assistant. It provides more fine-grained controls than other voice commands you might use on your phone—for example, letting you use your voice to "click" buttons and controls within apps, or scroll and navigate app screens. And while there are great benefits for individuals with Parkinson's disease, multiple sclerosis, arthritis, spinal cord injury and more, Voice Access can also provide value to people who don’t have a disability—people juggling with groceries or in the middle of cooking.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Screenshots of voice commands used by Voice Access" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/va4.max-1000x1000.png"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>Screenshots of voice commands used by Voice Access</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>When using Voice Access, you can compose and edit a text message hands free by saying “Ok Google,” and open your favorite app with the “open” command. Then, select the text field by speaking the number Voice Access displays next to it. After saying your message out loud, like “would you like to meet for lunch tomorrow?” you can edit the text using phrases like “replace tomorrow with Saturday” to change the day you want to meet. Speaking commands such as “delete the line” or “undo” will start over and when you’ve finished, you can say “stop listening.”  There are many more examples of available commands on our<a href="https://support.google.com/accessibility/android/answer/6151854?hl=en">support page</a>.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--medium h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--4 h-c-grid__col--offset-4 "><img alt="Screenshot of an Android homepage using Voice Access" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/va2.max-1000x1000.png"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption "><div class="rich-text"><p>Screenshot of an Android homepage using Voice Access</p></div></figcaption></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Feedback like Stefanie’s consistently shapes the future of Google’s products. You can help our <a href="https://www.google.com/accessibility/">Central Accessibility team</a> build even more accessible products by <a href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdB4n2IgI2dIqVsLcRdkwXA7UX3Uk6YIVXgtg-JuNt0W7UikA/viewform?entry.1840504930&amp;entry.767183713&amp;entry.56281283&amp;entry.2035380197&amp;entry.1567833329&amp;entry.1093159374&amp;entry.1787236126=tC515396&amp;fbzx=6407428873210151000">signing up to participate</a> in future user studies.   </p><p>Voice Access is available globally supporting English commands, with additional language support coming in the future.  <a href="https://www.google.com/accessibility/blog/post/android-voice-access.html">Learn more about Voice Access</a>  and <a href="https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.accessibility.voiceaccess&amp;e=-EnableAppDetailsPageRedesign">download the app from Google Play</a> today.</p></div></div></body></html>
title: Use your voice to access the world with a new Android app

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>I went to university to study art and media and wound up falling in love with computer science. I took an Introduction to Computer Programming course, and in the first class, we wrote a program that outputted the text, “Hello world.” After one class, I declared computer science as my second major.</p><br/><p>I had no idea what to expect, but representations in the media made me believe that computer science was incomprehensible and involved heavy machinery. In reality, it gave me the tools to be creative and build websites and applications. I created music videos out of cat GIFs, made animal noises for kids games, and visualized video game music.</p><br/><p>Although I loved it, studying computer science was not easy. When I first started out, there were many times when my classmates completely disregarded what I had to say, or laughed at me for not understanding specific programming terminology. The field is homogeneous, so I wasn't surrounded by a lot of other women who were going through the same experience that I was. And since I was usually one of the only woman in the room, I felt like I was under a microscope and that my performance in class was being scrutinized. It made me realize that the biggest barrier for young women in tech is the feeling that we don’t belong in the field.</p><br/><p>The first time I felt like I truly belonged was when I joined my university’s Women in Computing Club, which provided a support network that allowed me to explore the connection between computer science and my other interests. I love to do illustrations, and I learned to create web applications based on things I had sketched on paper. My favorite project I built was an application for keeping track of groceries. It included hand-drawn illustrations (by me) of the various things someone could input such as cereal, yogurt, etc.</p><br/><p>When I joined Google I got involved with <a href="https://www.madewithcode.com/">Made With Code</a>, a program that shows young women who feel like they don’t belong that they have a place in this field. I wanted to give other women the same sense of belonging I felt in my Women in Computing Club, and show them the creative and problem-solving potential of technology.</p><br/>Made With Code recently partnered with <a href="https://www.rookiemag.com/">Rookie</a>, an online magazine for teenagers, to host an event for 60 young women to learn more about technology. Although Rookie founder Tavi Gevinson and I have had very different career paths, we both used technology to find our voice. Using Made With Code’s new <a href="https://www.madewithcode.com/projects/collage">Collage Kit</a>, the girls played around with a visual programming editor to take objects, like rainbows and suns, and create animated collages. They also were able to use what they learned during the day to create paper zines with artist Kati Yewell.</div></div><div class="block-image_carousel"><div class="h-c-page article-module"><div class="article-module glue-pagination h-c-carousel h-c-carousel--simple h-c-carousel--dark ng-cloak" data-glue-pagination-config="{cyclical: true}"><div class="h-c-carousel__wrap"><ul class="glue-carousel ng-cloak" data-glue-carousel-options="{pointerTypes: ['touch', 'mouse'], jump: true}"><li class="h-c-carousel__item article-carousel__slide"><figure><div class="article-carousel__slide-img" style="background-image: url(https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/_DSC0606.max-2000x2000.jpg);"><span class="h-u-visually-hidden">_DSC0606.jpg</span></div><figcaption class="article-carousel__caption h-c-copy h-u-mt-std"><div class="rich-text"><p>Panel discussion between Tavi Gevinson (Founder of <a href="http://www.rookiemag.com/">Rookie</a>), Googler Neeka Farhad and me.</p></div></figcaption></figure></li><li class="h-c-carousel__item article-carousel__slide"><figure><div class="article-carousel__slide-img" style="background-image: url(https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/_DSC1223.max-2000x2000.jpg);"><span class="h-u-visually-hidden">_DSC1223.jpg</span></div><figcaption class="article-carousel__caption h-c-copy h-u-mt-std"><div class="rich-text"><p>Our guests getting crafty during the zine-making workshop.</p></div></figcaption></figure></li><li class="h-c-carousel__item article-carousel__slide"><figure><div class="article-carousel__slide-img" style="background-image: url(https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/_DSC1046.max-2000x2000.jpg);"><span class="h-u-visually-hidden">_DSC1046.jpg</span></div><figcaption class="article-carousel__caption h-c-copy h-u-mt-std"><div class="rich-text"><p>A Googler answers a guest's question.</p></div></figcaption></figure></li></ul><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate glue-pagination-previous" data-glue-pagination-label="Previous" data-glue-pagination-update-model="false"><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate-wrap"><svg class="h-c-icon h-c-icon--keyboard-arrow-left" role="img"><use xlink:href="#mi-keyboard-arrow-right"></use></svg></div></div><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate glue-pagination-next" data-glue-pagination-label="Next" data-glue-pagination-update-model="false"><div class="h-c-carousel__paginate-wrap"><svg class="h-c-icon h-c-icon--keyboard-arrow-right" role="img"><use xlink:href="#mi-keyboard-arrow-right"></use></svg></div></div></div><div class="h-c-carousel__navigation"><div class="glue-pagination-page-list"></div></div></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>I hope that this event shows young women that they shouldn’t discount their interests because of other people’s perceptions. It took a long time for me to realize that my love for computer science could exist alongside my other passions, and that there could be an entire community of people like me.  I love rom-coms, I love to read, and draw and dance (even though I have no rhythm) and I also love to code and create programs that help others. Finding communities helped me and gave me the comfort to pursue all of the things I love to do.</p></div></div></body></html>
title: Hello world: teaming up with Rookie to get girls into computer science

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Two years ago, Shoniqua Kemp was unemployed, homeless and living in a broken car with her 12-year-old daughter. It would have been easy to give in to despair, but Shoniqua had a conversation that would change the trajectory of her life. A friend told her about a nonprofit that was empowering people like her to escape poverty. Shoniqua was skeptical; it didn’t sound like the other assistance programs she knew. Nonetheless, she decided to attend the next meeting of the <a href="https://www.fii.org/">Family Independence Initiative</a> (FII). She wanted a better life for her daughter.</p><p></p><p>FII was founded in 2001 on the belief that low-income families can decide for themselves the best solutions to improve their lives, especially when guided by their own data. We believe in this approach, too, which is why Google.org is continuing our commitment to FII with over $2 million in new grants, and a team of full-time Google engineers who are lending their technical expertise.</p><br/><p>The fundamental components of FII’s <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7i9FGto8mQA">approach</a> are monthly group meetings and detailed journaling. For two years, each family keeps track of their goals, financial information and what academics would call “social capital exchange,” which are behaviors like helping one another with childcare or letting a neighbor borrow a car for a job interview. Families share this information on FII’s web platform called <a href="https://www.uptogether.org/">Uptogether</a>.</p><br/><p>Each family sets its own economic and social mobility goals, which might be buying a home or continuing a child’s education. By filling out journals, attending group meetings to share solutions, and receiving a $100/month stipend for doing both, they create a virtuous circle, reinforcing the habits of success. Over the two year life that families participate, they can earn up to $3,200.</p><br/><p>“I already had a circle of friends and, growing up, I kept a diary,” Shoniqua told us. “I wasn’t sure how the program was going to help.” But then she started getting the FII reports, which turned her monthly data into graphic charts, visual proof of progress. “There, in black and white, I could see all the positive things I was doing. It changed how I saw myself.”</p><br/><p>In 2015, we helped FII in California expand from 100 to 1,000 families. After two years, the families increased their income by 22 percent, their savings quadrupled and they decreased their reliance on government subsidies, such as food stamps, by 55 percent.</p><br/><p>We want to keep the momentum going. Last week, we <a href="https://www.fii.org/google-and-city-of-chicago-announce-2-6-million-commitment-to-launch-fii-chicago/'">announced</a> a $2 million grant to bring FII to Chicago, and today, along with the St. David’s Foundation, the Michael and Susan Dell Foundation, and the Harold Simmons Family Foundation, we’re helping expand FII to Austin, with a total commitment of $1.3 million.  </p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><figure class="article-image--full article-module "><img alt="chicago fii announcement" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/_1235306.max-1000x1000.jpg"/><figcaption class="article-image__caption h-c-page"><div class="rich-text"><p>Google.org and City of Chicago at an announcement event for the Family Independence Initiative last week. From left to right: Jesús Gerena, CEO, Family Independence Initiative; Samantha Hennessey, Manager, Google.org; Patricia Belden, Preservation of Affordable Housing Communities, President; Rob Biederman, Head of Government Relations &amp; Public Affairs, Midwest, Google; Lisa Morrison Butler, Commissioner - City of Chicago Department of Family and Support Services; Maab Ibrahim, Manager, Google.org; Ebony Scott, Chicago Site Director, Family Independence Initiative</p></div></figcaption></figure></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>In addition, for six months full-time, a group of six Googlers will build a tool that uses natural language processing to analyze the journal entries uploaded on UpTogether, looking for trends or patterns. With this new information, FII will gain a much deeper understanding of what leads to family success.</p><br/><p>Today, Shoniqua is no longer homeless, her income has quadrupled, and she was able to repair her car. But something else gives her the most pride. Last year, a middle-class woman told Shoniqua how she paid for college with a savings bond her parents had given her as a child. Shoniqua didn’t know savings bonds still existed. “It’s hard to talk about this without getting emotional,” she said, her voice catching. “But this year, I set aside enough money to buy a $200 savings bond in my daughter’s name.” She paused a moment, and then smiled. “My daughter is going to have generational wealth, just like that woman got from her parents.”</p><br/><p>Shoniqua is living proof that FII's approach can not only help families escape poverty, but thrive in a new life that they create for themselves. We're grateful to be part of a community of funders helping FII to reach 2,000 more families.</p></div></div></body></html>
title: Using data to empower families to escape poverty

description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Google turned the big 2-0 this past month. While the date is <a href="https://www.blog.google/inside-google/company-announcements/marking-20ish-years-google/">contested</a> (who really wants to keep track of their age that closely anyway?), Google’s helped people across the world accomplish quite a bit over the past two decades. <a href="https://www.blog.google/inside-google/company-announcements/twenty-years-building-everyone/">Here’s a snapshot</a>. Or you can give yourself <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/maps/inside-googles-original-garage-1998-style/">a tour</a> of the original garage!</p><p>In the G Suite world, we kicked off Next Tokyo this month and <a href="https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/g-suite/gain-deeper-organizational-insights-and-take-action-with-new-g-suite-features">launched new G Suite features</a> as a part of it. We announced the beta version of Work Insights—a way for you to gain a deeper understanding of how employees use G Suite to collaborate in your organization. We also made the security investigation tool available to G Suite users to help businesses stay on top of security controls.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Subhead 1 ICYMI G Suite" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/ICYMI-blogheader-01.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>Did you know there is a Chrome extension that lets you search for Drive files from within your Google Search bar? It’s awesome. You can download the Chrome extension <a href="https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/quick-search-for-google-d/ddebdlfmldojeofgkeocjdkloocegmae?hl=en">here</a>.</p></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="GoogleDriveChromeExt_tw.gif" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/original_images/GoogleDriveChromeExt_tw.gif"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-image_full_width"><div class="article-module h-c-page"><div class="h-c-grid"><figure class="article-image--large h-c-grid__col h-c-grid__col--6 h-c-grid__col--offset-3 "><img alt="Subhead 2 ICYMI G Suite" src="https://storage.googleapis.com/gweb-uniblog-publish-prod/images/ICYMI-blogheader-02.max-1000x1000.png"/></figure></div></div></div><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><p>→ <b>Smart Compose</b> is available in G Suite now. Type on.</p><p>→ If you’ve ever wished you could comment on a Microsoft file like you do in <b>Google Docs</b> (because it’s awesome), now you can if you save the file in Drive. <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l3eKz5cpND0&amp;feature=youtu.be&amp;t=32m43s">Check out this demo</a> to see how to comment on Word, Excel or PowerPoint files.</p><p>→ We’ve beefed up our conference capabilities with third-parties in <b>Calendar</b>. Now you can join meetings natively in Calendar through add-ons from Cisco, Dialpad, LogMeIn, RingCentral and Vonage instead of downloading a separate Chrome extension. One less step. (Or you can always use <a href="https://gsuite.google.com/products/meet/">Hangouts Meet</a>. ;)).</p><p>→ Speaking of <b>Hangouts Meet</b>, now up to 100,000 people can livestream meetings—great for global company-wide meetings or executive presentations.</p><p>→ The <b>Google Sheets add-on for Salesforce</b> is ready for use. It can help you import data and reports from Salesforce into Sheets, and push updates back to Salesforce. <a href="https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/data-connector-for-salesf/jijmhhpjhgeafilgjkdeocjepoacekof">Read more</a>.</p><p>→ We’re testing out a new feature for businesses in <b>Drive</b> called <b>Priority Workspaces</b>. It uses machine learning to help people find information quicker in Drive. Admins can apply for the beta <a href="https://gsuite.google.com/campaigns/index__drive-priority.html">here</a>.</p><p>→ By popular demand, now you can edit jams from the web on <b>Jamboard</b>. We also added a new “view only” option.</p><p>Check out the <a href="https://goo.gl/oDH22u">full recap</a> of product updates in September. Cheerio!</p></div></div></body></html>
title: ICYMI in September: here’s what happened in G Suite

description: <p><br/></p><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><section><p style="text-align: center;"><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2018/10/01/amazon-planning-new-free-video-service-compete-tv-dollars.html#"><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201810/02034858/f6szxe0dmc0i9w3k!heading" data-img-size-val="644,362" width="644"/></a><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif; color: #999999; font-size: 12px; text-align: center;">亚马逊创始人兼首席执行官Jeff Bezos</span></p><p><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/?symbol=AMZN"></a></p><p style="text-align: justify;">据 CNBC 报道，几位知情人士透露，亚马逊(Amazon)的子公司 IMDb 预计将于本周宣布，为亚马逊 Fire TV 用户提供免费的、但支持广告投放的视频服务。新服务将类似于 Roku 频道或 Hulu 的部分内容，内容以电视节目和电影为主。这项服务将面向所有 Fire TV 用户，而不仅仅是Amazon Prime视频用户。</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>这一举措可能帮助亚马逊从利润丰厚的电视广告市场获得收入。</strong>eMarketer 预计，今年美国电视广告市场的营收将接近 700 亿美元。根据 Merkle 的数据，高端电视服务的广告预算仅为 70 亿美元左右。但市场正在迅速增长。</p><p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>这项服务还将帮助亚马逊继续扩大其在数字广告市场的份额。</strong>根据 eMarketer 的数据，亚马逊现在是第三大数字广告商，拥有 4% 的市场份额，市场领头羊谷歌和 Facebook 加起来超过 57%。</p><p style="text-align: justify;">在这项新服务中，广告可以在内容之间出现，营销人员还可以将广告包装并投放到嵌入视频的“播放器”上——这种体验类似于许多视频网站所采用的广告投放方案。此前，亚马逊已经允许在 Fire TV 应用程序上播放广告，并在其庞大的用户群中获得了相关用户及内容数据。</p><p style="text-align: justify;">一位代理商高管表示，为了吸引更多品牌，亚马逊将允许营销人员使用其专有数据，帮助 Fire TV 推行此次的视频广告服务。亚马逊预计将占据美国约一半的市场份额。根据 eMarketer 的数据，到今年年底，美国的电子商务市场将达到一个新的高度,公司可以将这些信息与消费者的第三方数据结合起来，为广告商提供建议，告诉他们消费者认为广告放在哪里更合理。</p><p style="text-align: justify;">据知情人士透露，亚马逊已经与至少三家主要媒体公司进行了谈判，希望将他们的节目引入新的 Fire TV 服务，内容包括已推出的节目和电影。一位广告业务高管表示，亚马逊也考虑过推出一款支持广告的 Prime 视频服务。亚马逊表示，它没有计划提供免费的、广告支持的 Prime 视频版本。</p><p style="text-align: justify;">两名知情人士说，这一消息将于本周在“纽约广告周”期间宣布，亚马逊拒绝对这篇文章中的其他报道发表评论。</p></section></ul>
title: 亚马逊旗下IMDb将于本周宣布全新免费视频服务，以争夺电视广告收入

description: <p>周一，Google 发布博文宣布推出 Project Steam（流媒体计划），虽然&nbsp;Google&nbsp;将它称之为“技术测试”，但 Google 仍然向着&nbsp;<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AAA_(video_game_industry)">AAA级游戏</a>流媒体平台迈进了一大步。</p><p>同时，&nbsp;Google 还宣布了与&nbsp;<a href="https://www.blog.google/technology/developers/pushing-limits-streaming-technology/">Ubisoft</a>&nbsp;的合作——在 PC 端的&nbsp;Chrome 浏览器内，<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">用户将可以</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">玩</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">即将上线的《</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">刺客信条：奥德赛</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">》，从 10 月 5 日开始，&nbsp;Google 将</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">邀请少量玩家免费参与内测。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"></span></p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201810/02063521/pe7brlpk8dln3px0.png!heading" data-img-size-val="1064,590"/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Google 在公布&nbsp;Project Steam 的<a href="https://blog.google/technology/developers/pushing-limits-streaming-technology/" target="_blank">博文</a>中写到：</span></p><blockquote><p>当人们观看流媒体电视或电影时，消费者能够接受播放前几秒钟的缓冲，但采用流式传输的高质量游戏，延迟必须控制在毫秒，否则图像质量就会下降，影响游戏体验。而为了实现流媒体控制器与游戏中的图形之间近乎即时的交互，这就给开发人员带来了许多挑战。</p><p>这些 AAA级游戏背后的技术和创造力是非凡的——从逼真的人物皮肤、衣服和头发细节，到游戏中的宏观背景，最后到每一棵花草树木。每一帧像素都是一系列实时渲染技术、艺术和视觉效果、动画、仿真、物理和动力学精心设计的结果。受游戏创作者的启发，我们正在研发可以支持并赋予流媒体创造力的技术。</p></blockquote><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">如果想参加《刺客信条：奥德赛》的内测，你必须居住在美国并且年满 17 岁，同时你的带宽要达到 25 Mbps 以上，并拥有 Google 和&nbsp;</span>Ubisoft 账户<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">，硬件设备支持有线 PlayStation、Xbox One 和 360 控制器，也可以使用鼠标和键盘。</span></p><p>虽然还不清楚 Google 是否会将这项服务转变为付费服务，但&nbsp;Google 不会投资无法商业化的技术。<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">除了</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">&nbsp;Google ，</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Ubisoft 还在尝试</span><a href="https://www.gamespot.com/articles/assassins-creed-odyssey-releasing-on-switch-in-jap/1100-6461769/" style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">通过云服务器将《刺客信条：奥德赛》引进日本的 Nintendo Switch</a><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">早在 2015 年，英伟达花费数年时间开发和测试了一个绝佳的流媒体游戏服务—— GeForce NOW 。</span><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">它能提供 1080p/60fps 的高清游戏体验，包含低延迟的游戏控制器，高效的 Tegra 处理器，独家的 Gameworks 特效，以及由 GeForce gtx 显卡构筑的强大的游戏引擎，每月收费 7.99 美元。但这项服务虽然体验绝佳但使用者却寥寥无几。</span></p><p>一是它仅支持在 shield 平板上使用，而 shield 平板市场占有量则远低于 3ds 与 PlayStationvita；二是<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">在长达三个月的体验测试中，GeForce NOW 仅推出了五十个游戏；三是 GeForce NOW 对带宽的要求极高，国内的 5G 网络和 WIFI 环境难以支持流畅的游戏体验。</span></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Google 自然拥有比&nbsp;shield&nbsp;更广泛的用户群体，但游戏的输出量依然会影响到&nbsp;Project Steam 的生命周期，同时，对带宽的限制也会拉高国内玩家的体验门槛。</span></p>
title: 在Chrome中玩「刺客信条：奥德赛」？Google推出Project Steam

description: <p>Julia 1.0.1 发布了，这是 Julia 1.0 的第一个补丁版本。它仅包含错误修正和性能改进，没有新功能或其他变更。</p><h3>Bug fixes</h3><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28568">#28568</a>&nbsp;- Fix vec of adjoint vector</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28592">#28592</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28576">#28576</a>, parsing&nbsp;<code>?</code>&nbsp;at end of input in conditional expression</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28620">#28620</a>&nbsp;- Fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28619">#28619</a>, logabsdet for singular matrices</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28642">#28642</a>&nbsp;- Keep parametric information when constructing a SparseMatrixCSC from &amp;hellip;</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28655">#28655</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28641">#28641</a>, passing typevars to&nbsp;<code>&lt;:</code>&nbsp;in typejoin and tuplemerge</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28656">#28656</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28499">#28499</a>, calling&nbsp;<code>cluster_cookie</code>&nbsp;before cluster starts</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28659">#28659</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28597">#28597</a>, error for empty arrays with some negative dim sizes</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28684">#28684</a>&nbsp;- LinearAlgebra remove unused export</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28677">#28677</a>&nbsp;- smarter order of checks in jl_types_equal</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28693">#28693</a>&nbsp;- fix some exported undefined variables and test this does not happen</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28694">#28694</a>&nbsp;- fix REPL completions not always being unique</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28732">#28732</a>&nbsp;- Carry LLVM patch to fix incorrect codegen</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28742">#28742</a>&nbsp;- Fix missing GC root in interpreter.c</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28747">#28747</a>&nbsp;- Fix missing gc root in jl_cglobal</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28751">#28751</a>&nbsp;- Fix three missing gc roots in subtyping</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28727">#28727</a>&nbsp;- fix shuffle! on empty arrays</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28749">#28749</a>&nbsp;- Resolve all method ambiguities in LinearAlgebra</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28832">#28832</a>&nbsp;- Added seekstart to getpass in base/util.jl (<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28828">#28828</a>)</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28780">#28780</a>&nbsp;- make cmp with BigInt return in [-1, 0, 1]</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28706">#28706</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28593">#28593</a>, macro hygiene problems in type definitions</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28625">#28625</a>&nbsp;- absolutify --project path</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28651">#28651</a>&nbsp;- Support parallelizing over collections that have non-Int lengths</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28875">#28875</a>&nbsp;- fix doccing call overload without named argument</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28871">#28871</a>&nbsp;- issubset aces Discrete Math but flunks Topology</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28910">#28910</a>&nbsp;- doc: fix accumulate examples not using the init keyword</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28682">#28682</a>&nbsp;- Fix download agent search relying on throwing of Sys.which(). Update t&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28157">#28157</a></p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28951">#28951</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28915">#28915</a>, identity conversion to union of tuple types</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29043">#29043</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28900">#28900</a>, macro hygiene bug inside keyword arg values</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29044">#29044</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28991">#28991</a>, error when adding default defs to constructed module Exprs</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28882">#28882</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28833">#28833</a>, crash in macros returning certain top-level forms</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29070">#29070</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29064">#29064</a>, bug in field name same as struct type name</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29072">#29072</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/25955">#25955</a>, hygiene of arg name of function defined by type</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29139">#29139</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/22592">#22592</a>, specificity of union compared to a subtype of it</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29148">#29148</a>&nbsp;- ndigits with negative base: error out instead of giving incorrect result</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29159">#29159</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/25474">#25474</a>, support more forms in edit, which, etc. macros</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29154">#29154</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29145">#29145</a>, error for&nbsp;<code>new{}</code>&nbsp;with incomplete type</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29194">#29194</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29175">#29175</a>, invalid lowered IR from repeating code for declared types</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29056">#29056</a>&nbsp;- Improve support for constructing zero-step float ranges</p></li></ul><h3>Performance improvements</h3><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28661">#28661</a>&nbsp;- improve performance for number to string conversion functions</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28670">#28670</a>&nbsp;- fix performance in printf</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28707">#28707</a>&nbsp;- Fix reinterpret performance</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28787">#28787</a>&nbsp;- improve performance of parse</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28847">#28847</a>&nbsp;- Remove bounds checks in iterate(::Tuple)</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28876">#28876</a>&nbsp;- improve performance for string(...)</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28873">#28873</a>&nbsp;- Compare Symbols and Chars more efficiently in Cholesky</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28954">#28954</a>&nbsp;- fixed regression in sparse of adjoint of sparse (<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28948">#28948</a>)</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29045">#29045</a>&nbsp;- Fix dispatch of SparseMatrixCSC*Diagonal multiplication</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29060">#29060</a>&nbsp;- work around a splatting penalty in twiceprecision</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29086">#29086</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29083">#29083</a>, not eliminating kwfunc due to logic error in builtin_nothrow</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29133">#29133</a>&nbsp;- fix perf regression from not specializing on iterate on tuples</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29116">#29116</a>&nbsp;- fix perf in exp(::Matrix) (for smallish matrices)</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29186">#29186</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28481">#28481</a>, faster reading of primitive types from IOStream and IOBuffer</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29075">#29075</a>&nbsp;- fix&nbsp;<a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/29036">#29036</a>, large slowdown in Change quit() to exit()</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28657">#28657</a>&nbsp;- Fix input args in rem_pio2_kernel doc string</p></li><li><p><a fix typo in a docstring</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28649">#28649</a>&nbsp;- Complete uuids</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28699">#28699</a>&nbsp;- add a code quote to a word</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28702">#28702</a>&nbsp;- Use code font for&nbsp;<code>jl_value_t</code>&nbsp;in h2</p></li><li><p><a href="https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/28514">#28514</a>&nbsp;- Doc sorting algos</p></li><li><p><a description: <html><head></head><body><div class="block-paragraph"><div class="rich-text"><br/><p>Blue: the color of ocean waves, the bright sky, sapphires and now … our latest Google Home Mini. Well, we’re actually calling it Aqua, and this new color is the first one we’ve added since we launched Google Home Mini last year.</p><br/><p>It’s made from the same fabric as the Mini’s original colors—chalk, charcoal and coral—with the same aesthetic goal, to easily blend into your home. Aqua Mini does all the great things you expect from your Google Assistant and Google Home, like:</p><ul><li><a href="https://www.blog.google/products/assistant/meet-bilingual-google-assistant-new-smart-home-devices/">Speaking two languages</a> interchangeably. <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/assistant/meet-bilingual-google-assistant-new-smart-home-devices/"><br/></a></li><li>Playing music from YouTube Music, Pandora, and Spotify. <br/></li><li>Sharing a message with everyone in the house with <a href="https://www.blog.google/products/assistant/communicate-around-the-house-with-the-google-assistant/">Broadcast</a>. <br/></li><li>Helping you locate your phone simply with a quick “Ok Google, find my phone.” Android phones will ring even when on silent. <br/></li></ul>And of course, you can ask it some fun questions to get to know the Google Assistant. Here are a few of our favorites, just start with “Hey Google,”<br/><ul><li>Tell me a secret.<br/></li><li>Tell me a joke.<br/></li><li>Spell supercalifragilisticexpialidocious.<br/></li><li>Tag you're it.<br/></li><li>What sound does a unicorn make?<br/></li></ul><p>Google Home Mini in Aqua will be available from the Google Store and Walmart online later this month.  </p></div></div></body></html>
title: Something new that’s also blue—new Aqua Mini

description: <p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201810/02030551/kfbbcrz2how06u5t!heading" data-img-size-val="720,479" width="720" style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;"/></p><p style="text-align: justify;"><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">今日</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">在芝加哥举办了教育主题相关活动，并首次宣布了公司</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">出的</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">新版“</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">Everyone Can Create（人人都能创造）</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">”课程。该课程加入了</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">苹果</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">公司</span><span style="text-align: justify; font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">&nbsp;“Everyone Can Code（人人都能编程）”计划，为教师提供了一种将绘画、音乐、电影制作和摄影融入课堂教学计划的新方案。</span><br/></p><p style="text-align: justify;">具体来说，“Everyone Can Create”是为了将苹果公司今年 3 月在芝加哥举行的活动上推出的 9.7 英寸iPad和 Apple Pencils（苹果铅笔）利用起来。在推出之前，只有苹果产品线较为昂贵的 iPad Pro 机型支持其铅笔应用于课程。不过，与之前的 9.7 英寸 iPad 一样，新款 iPad 面向学校的售价仅为 299 美元。(普通消费版 329 美元。)</p><p style="text-align: justify;">课程本身由苹果公司与教师和教育工作者合作建立，可与苹果的内置应用程序（如 GarageBand，iMovie，Clips 等）一起使用。自今年早些时候有消息传出消息以来，它就一直处于预览状态，全球 350 多所学校的教育工作者参与了软件的试用。苹果公司表示，现在它将向所有人开放。</p><p><img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201810/02030550/e3gxuc9xi7v9v3do!heading" data-img-size-val="678,552"/></p><p style="text-align: justify;">课程中包括四个项目，分别是绘画、音乐、视频和照片。每个项目都有一系列逐步建立技能的指南。软件中，共有 300 个不同媒体、项目和科目的课程教案。</p><p style="text-align: justify;">值得一提的是，并非所有教育工作者从事的都是专注于创意艺术的科目。例如，苹果在其公告中解释说，数学老师可以使用 iPad 相机的连拍模式捕捉篮球投掷的弧度以测量其抛物线；学生可以使用相机了解分形，或使用苹果铅笔结合应用程序来了解对称性。</p><p style="text-align: justify;">“我们相信，苹果的技术可以帮助激发每个孩子的创造力。”苹果全球营销高级副总裁 Philip Schiller 在一份有关该教育产品的声明中表示。“我们与教师紧密合作，共同建立了 Everyone Can Create 课程，帮助学生将创造性的表达和艺术带入课堂。学生通过创造力保持与课程间的参与紧密度，并最终取得更大的成功。”<img src="https://pic.36krcnd.com/201810/02030551/iarrug02u1s0aizu!heading" data-img-size-val="678,552"/></p><p style="text-align: justify;">事实证明，苹果之前的“Everyone Can Code”课程已经相当成功，目前全世界有 5000 多所学校、社区学院和技术学院在使用这门课程。它还提供了一个大型的第三方教育应用程序库供教师使用——如今这个程序库里<span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">有近 20 万个应用程序。</span></p><p style="text-align: justify;">“Everyone Can Create”现已在 Apple Books 上以英文提供，其他语言将于2018年底推出。Apple Stores 还将在 Apple Teacher 周二的会议上展示“Everyone Can Create”。</p>
title: 苹果将在Apple Books上推出“Everyone Can Create”课程

description: <p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">随着十一长假到来，腾讯在支付战场上又完成了一次突破。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">从2018年10月1日开始，腾讯、腾讯金融科技联合银联，通过“微信香港钱包”，为香港用户在内地消费提供移动支付服务，也就是双向跨境支付。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">在此之前，香港居民要在内地消费先要在入境时将港币兑换为人民币，返港时再将手中人民币兑换为港币，换汇的差价且不论，其过程就足够费时费力。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">而双向跨境支付意味着，今后香港居民再来到内地消费的时候，只需打开“微信香港钱包（WeChat Pay HK）”，便可像内地居民一样通过扫描二维码进行支付，微信钱包将自动将所付人民币金额转换为港币，在用户钱包余额或是事先绑定的银行卡账户中扣除相应金额。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">不过，目前尚有额度限制。如用户未通过身份认证，每个已绑定信用卡/银行账户的微信香港钱包账户于内地商户交易不得超过港币25,000，单笔交易不得超过港币10,000。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">据香港统计处统计数据，目前香港约有52万人长居广东省，除了定居的香港人，也有越来越多港人来内地旅游、消费。2017年由香港进入内地的港人次数达到8000万，累计花费超过300亿美元。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">但当港人在内地的通行、旅游和消费越来越方便的时候，面对所有消费的最后一个环节——支付，却依然存在不少限制。近年来香港的移动支付发展很快，微信支付、支付宝都在香港做了本地钱包。但一旦跨境回到内地，香港本地钱包反而无法使用，而港人在内地开设银行账户的手续也非常繁琐。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">双向跨境是微信香港钱包的又一个新功能落地，而作为首家提供双向跨境支付的支付工具，这也意味着内地清算市场正式对境外支付机构打开。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">据36氪了解，在中国人民银行及香港金融管理局的支持下，这次合作将由财付通、微信香港钱包、中国银联以及银联国际四方共同完成，四方的合作模式为：香港用户在内地使用微信香港钱包进行消费后，产生的资金结算流程将由微信香港钱包对接银联国际，再由中国银联对接财付通，转接交易并清算资金。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">目前，微信香港钱包已支持用户绑定中国银行（香港）、工银亚洲、大新银行和中信（国际）的储蓄账户及香港任何银行的Visa和Mastercard信用卡。还可以通过汇丰、渣打、花旗、恒生在内的香港17家银行的直接付款授权充值。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">此外，用户可在线下门店使用现金充值，全港的7-Eleven便利店、Circle K便利店和麦当劳餐厅均支持此项功能。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">为此，腾讯已经接入了不少国民级应用场景——首批即接入12306铁路售票、滴滴出行、美团、大众点评等平台。也就是说，港人在内地用微信钱包可以买高铁票、打车、点外卖、订酒店等。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">随着国内人口红利的逐渐消失，海外是每一家成熟中国互联网公司都会觊觎的市场。而移动支付，可以说是中国移动互联网出海的典型样本。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">关于腾讯移动支付出海的逻辑，腾讯金融科技副总裁陈起儒曾表示，“腾讯在境外支付业务布局上有两条发展路径，一是通过跨境支付满足中国游客境外旅行的支付需求，另一方面则是在微信用户量比较高的地区申请当地的支付牌照，以本地钱包向当地居民提供吃穿住行一站式的服务。”</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">在第一条路径下，腾讯移动支付目前已支持超过40个国家和地区的合规接入，支持超过13个币种（包括人民币）直接交易。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">在第二条路径下，腾讯有已经迅速打开市场并有着成熟应用场景的微信香港钱包，其马来西亚钱包也在今年7月正式上线运营。</span><br/></p><p><span style="font-family: &quot;PingFang SC&quot;, &quot;Lantinghei SC&quot;, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, &quot;Microsoft YaHei&quot;, 微软雅黑, STHeitiSC-Light, simsun, 宋体, &quot;WenQuanYi Zen Hei&quot;, &quot;WenQuanYi Micro Hei&quot;, sans-serif;">从满足国人在海外的支付需求，到在境外地区申请当地支付牌照做本地钱包，再到如今的满足境外用户在中国境内的支付需求，腾讯金融科技的国际化探索已经走入第三个阶段——连接境外支付机构和内地支付清算市场，让两个市场真正开始了互联互通。</span></p>
title: 微信支付国际化再突破：十一开始香港居民可在内地使用微信钱包

description: <p>妙控板2（Magic Trackpad 2）是苹果推出的一款支持多指触控以及触控力度感应的无线/有线触控板，其触控面积比前代产品增大近30%。遗憾的是，自其推出以来，即便有一些开发者为它开发模块，以使其支持Linux，可是Magic Trackpad 2从未获得过任何主流Linux内核的直接支持。<br/></p><p>自2015年来，越来越多的人对在Linux上使用Magic Trackpad 2感兴趣，幸运的是，Google的员工，来自Chrome OS团队的Sean O&#39;Brien一直致力于让Linux内核支持Magic Trackpad 2，专注于让它成为主流。为此，他开发了一个补丁。<br/></p><p><img alt="" data-cke-saved-src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/f5e13d8a08b9dc6216b95b3bc2c15cf4c71.jpg" src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/f5e13d8a08b9dc6216b95b3bc2c15cf4c71.jpg"/><br/></p><p>该补丁得到了Google Chrome OS其它开发人员的审核，其最终版本将很快发布。这个包含149行代码的补丁扩展了现有的Linux HID Magic Mouse驱动程序，以使其支持Magic Trackpad 2（既支持USB有线连接，又支持蓝牙无线连接）。</p><p>要了解关于该补丁的更多信息，请<a data-cke-saved-href="http://lkml.iu.edu/hypermail/linux/kernel/1809.2/05203.html" href="http://lkml.iu.edu/hypermail/linux/kernel/1809.2/05203.html" target="_blank">点击这里</a>。</p><p>来源：<a data-cke-saved-href="http://www.ithome.com/html/it/386456.htm" href="http://www.ithome.com/html/it/386456.htm" target="_blank">IT之家</a>&nbsp;作者：文轩</p>
rss_title: 开源中国社区最新新闻
title: 感谢谷歌员工：Linux 内核已支持苹果 Magic Trackpad 2

description: <p>DB-Engines 的数据库流行度排行榜已经<a data-cke-saved-href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking" target="_blank" href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking">发布</a>了 10 月份的数据，先来看一下大榜单，排名前二十如下：</p><p><img alt="" data-cke-saved-src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/b032afadbf47ced78786d3534f7fb8957f2.jpg" src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/b032afadbf47ced78786d3534f7fb8957f2.jpg"/><br/></p><p>可以看到，在本次排行榜中，Oracle、PostgreSQL、MongoDB 和 Redis 这四个数据库的分数增长最高，前两者都获得了 10 分以上的增长。尤其是 PostgreSQL，PostgreSQL 数据库在<a data-cke-saved-href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99527/db-engines-index-2018-09" target="_blank" href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99527/db-engines-index-2018-09"> 9 月份</a>的排行榜中分数出现了不小的下滑(-11.07)，上个月开源中国<a data-cke-saved-href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99527/db-engines-index-2018-09" target="_blank" href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99527/db-engines-index-2018-09">曾报道过</a>，若按此趋势，MongoDB 今年或者有望将&nbsp;PostgreSQL 挤下第四名的位置。但这个月&nbsp;PostgreSQL 凭借增长&nbsp;12.97 分成为分数增长最多的数据库，再次将&nbsp;MongoDB 甩掉了一个段位。</p><p>另外一个获得 10 分以上增长的 Oracle 同样引人瞩目，在 9 月份排行榜中分数出现下滑的它，这个月分数增长了&nbsp;10.15。MongoDB 发挥稳定，继续保持着稳定的增长速度，截至 10 月，MongoDB 的分数已经连续增长 12 个月，能在前二十名的数据库中保持这个记录的，独此一个。Redis 虽然在 9 月经历了不少的风波，但与上月对比，依然前进一个名次，超过了 Elasticsearch ，以微弱优势位列第七名。</p><p>其他方面没有十分值得关注的变动，完整排名请查看&nbsp;<a data-cke-saved-href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking" href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking" target="_blank">https://db-engines.com/en/ranking</a></p><p>接下来我们再来看看这些增长明显的数据库在上个月有着怎样的经历。</p><p>先来说一说 Oracle 公司，在最近的一个月中，Oracle 经历了<a data-cke-saved-href="https://www.oschina.net/news/100430/product-development-vp-of-oracle-resigned" target="_blank" href="https://www.oschina.net/news/100430/product-development-vp-of-oracle-resigned">人事上的动荡</a>，这引起了整个行业的关注，Oracle 技术体系的 2 号人物&nbsp;Thomas Kurian&nbsp;在这个 9 月正式离开了 Oracle 公司，虽然个中原委不得而知，但是 Oracle 在云上的转略转移显然是根本原因，有人将 Oracle 云战略的执行缓慢归罪于 TK，也有谣传说 Ellision 希望擢升 Don Johnson 而引发冲突。原因不详，但是据说 Oracle 的股价得以提升，<strong>也许有时候变化孕育着希望</strong>。<br/></p><p>看一下&nbsp;<strong>Don Johnson 在 LinkedIn 上的简历，原来这是一位来自 AWS 干将，在 Oracle 公司基本上是每年提升一个级别 Senior Director 到 Vice President，再到 Senior VP，显然成为了 Oracle 云转型的核心技术派</strong>。话说硅谷是一家，做完这家做那家。只是不知道&nbsp;Thomas Kurian 下一站将落往何处？原本有希望角逐 Oracle CEO的大BOSS，现在自由了。<br/></p><p><img alt="" data-cke-saved-src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/52756a6c7190a02115c2809e4f96492be73.jpg" src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/52756a6c7190a02115c2809e4f96492be73.jpg"/><br/></p><p>那么现在 Oracle 的局面是，不仅仅&nbsp;Don Johnson 获得了擢升，在没有公开指定 TK 的角色前，所有 TK 的下属，现在都将直接向 Larry Ellision 汇报，也就是<strong>大家都升了一级。这能算皆大欢喜吗</strong>？<br/></p><p>Redis 最近的风斗也正盛，Redis Labs 的 CTO <a data-cke-saved-href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99271/redis-database-license-change" target="_blank" href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99271/redis-database-license-change">最近怼了一把云服务商</a>：</p><blockquote><p>数据库开发商 Redis Labs 本周将该公司开发的 Redis 模块由 AGPL 改成了 Apache v2.0 和 Commons Clause（共用条款）相结合的许可证，因而对销售许可证涵盖的软件作了限制。</p><p>新许可证限制了云提供商向客户提供这些 Redis 模块的能力；Redis Labs 可能旨在成为包含这些附加组件的服务的销售商。然而，Redis 数据库代码仍采用 BSD 许可证。</p><p>Redis Labs 的联合创始人兼首席技术官伊夫塔奇•舒尔曼（Yiftach Shoolman）在周三的一篇博文中针对许可证的这一变化给出了理由，声称云提供商得益于开源软件，却没有给予任何回报。</p></blockquote><p>9月 Redis <a data-cke-saved-href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99797/redis-master-slave-terminology" target="_blank" href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99797/redis-master-slave-terminology">经历了改名风波</a>，由于 master-slave 的使用被指责具有歧视色彩，而被迫宣布改名，引用一段文字，各位看官吃瓜观战：</p><blockquote><p>Master/Slave 模式，是分布式系统中一个比较常用的计算结构。这个词最开始来源于 MySQL 数据库，主要表示 MySQL 数据库自身提供的主从复制功能，通过 master-slave，可以方便的实现数据的多处自动备份，实现数据库的拓展。多个数据备份不仅可以加强数据的安全性，通过实现读写分离还能进一步提升数据库的负载性能。</p><p>这个名词由两个单词组合而成：Master 和 Slave。</p><p>Master：主人、雇主。 Slave：奴，奴隶。</p><p>随着人们开始越来越重视人权、歧视等问题，很多开发者认为这一描述具有侵犯性。所以，出现了很多声音呼吁修改这一描述。他们的主要诉求是不要使用<code>master-slave</code>这一词汇，而是使用其他词汇代替。</p><p>这件事儿之所以最近这么受重视，是因为比较关键的技术被要求修改，那就是 Redis 和 Python。</p></blockquote><p><strong>Redis 已经做出了改变：</strong></p><blockquote><p><strong>短期变化</strong></p><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p>将 master-slave 架构的描述改为 master-replica</p></li><li><p>为 SLAVEOF 提供别名 REPLICAOF，所以仍然可以使用 SLAVEOF，但多了一个选项</p></li><li><p>保持继续使用 slave 来对 INFO 和 ROLE 进行回应，现在目前看来，这仍然是一个重大的破坏性变更</p></li></ul><p><strong>长期变化</strong></p><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p>编写一个 INFO 的替代品</p></li><li><p>在内部替换很多东西，因为技术原因，如果作了改动，许多 PR 也会无法应用，所以必须在某些地方进行大变动</p></li></ul></blockquote><p>所以看一看 Oracle 命名的：Primary 和 Standby 多有先见之明！然而关于&nbsp;<strong>Redis 的争论也充分说明了这一产品的广泛影响力和重要性</strong>。</p><p>如果说 10 月数据库排行 Oracle 和 Redis 是最值得关注的两员，相信 Redis 的后劲仍然凶猛，而 Oracle 一旦醒来，仍然是无可匹敌的霸主王者。<br/></p><p>最后我们不妨看一下前十名的<a data-cke-saved-href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking_trend" target="_blank" href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking_trend">趋势变化图</a>：</p><p><img alt="" data-cke-saved-src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/271a963036b3c6b1d9c7e9800736e78609a.jpg" src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/271a963036b3c6b1d9c7e9800736e78609a.jpg"/><br/></p><p>DB-Engines 根据受欢迎程度对数据库管理系统进行排名，排名每月更新一次。排名的数据<a data-cke-saved-href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking_definition" href="https://db-engines.com/en/ranking_definition">依据 5 个不同的指标</a>：</p><ol class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p>Google 以及 Bing 搜索引擎的关键字搜索数量</p></li><li><p>Google Trends 的搜索数量</p></li><li><p>Indeed 网站中的职位搜索量</p></li><li><p>LinkedIn 中提到关键字的个人资料数</p></li><li><p>Stackoverflow 上相关的问题和关注者数量</p></li></ol><p>这份榜单分析旨在为数据库相关从业人员提供一个技术方向的参考，其中涉及到的排名情况并非基于产品的技术先进程度或市场占有率等因素。无论排名先后，选择适合与企业业务需求相比配的技术，才是最重要的。<br/></p><p>部分内容来自<a data-cke-saved-href="https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MjM5MDAxOTk2MQ==&amp;mid=2650279576&amp;idx=1&amp;sn=43873f856bc77a59c2b9c47a703e29ef&amp;chksm=be47968e89301f98a5a5af04c7f480756211854acc8ecf51f9ba9dfc11dcd72d53b3afaf9508&amp;mpshare=1&amp;scene=23&amp;srcid=1001JY4DCG29XShSBPxhfADE#rd" href="https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MjM5MDAxOTk2MQ==&mid=2650279576&idx=1&sn=43873f856bc77a59c2b9c47a703e29ef&chksm=be47968e89301f98a5a5af04c7f480756211854acc8ecf51f9ba9dfc11dcd72d53b3afaf9508&mpshare=1&scene=23&srcid=1001JY4DCG29XShSBPxhfADE#rd" target="_blank">数据和云</a>公众号</p>

description: <p>近日，Intel向其OpenCV开源计算机视觉库提交了第一批Vulkan API支持代码，可用来加速视觉计算。</p><p>OpenCV库针对Intel处理器、多核心x86架构的优化十分到位，而加入Vulkan支持之后，开发者无需重写代码，即可将其神经网络应用一直到GPU计算平台。<br/></p><p>目前，Vulkan后端已经支持Convolution、Concat、ReLU、LRN、PriorBox、Softmax、MaxPooling、AvePooling、Permute等各种计算类型，而根据源代码更新说明，这还只是Vulkan在OpenCV深度神经网络应用上的开始，更多支持和性能优化正在进行之中。<br/></p><p>很显然，Intel已经不满足于孱弱的核芯显卡，其在深度学习等方面实在难以为继，独立显卡、提供强大算力势在必行，Vulkan则凭借源代码开放、特性丰富、性能强大而成为Intel的新宠。</p><p>Intel此前官方已经表态，将在2020年推出独立显卡产品，代号Arctic Sound，不但面向专业计算市场，还会进入游戏市场。</p><p>为此，Intel已经挖走了AMD RTG显卡部门原来的负责人Raja Koduri，以及曾在ATI/AMD工作多年、具有丰富GPU研发经历的Joseph Facca，甚至跑到AMD显卡研发基地加拿大多伦多开设了实验室。</p><p>来自：<a href="http://news.mydrivers.com/1/597/597153.htm" target="_blank">快科技</a> 参考：<a href="https://www.phoronix.com/scan.php?page=news_item&px=Intel-Vulkan-OpenCV-Backend" target="_blank">https://www.phoronix.com/</a></p>
rss_title: 开源中国社区最新新闻
title: 英特尔 OpenCV 库支持 Vulkan：独立显卡正在走来

description: <p><img src="https://static.oschina.net/uploads/space/2018/1002/081440_B6XD_2720166.jpg"/></p><blockquote><p>目前，国产浏览器不仅仅需要弥补技术上的不足，更需要增加一种“不将就”的情怀和公信力。<br/></p></blockquote><p>百年之前鲁迅先生发表了中国第一篇白话文小说《狂人日记》，除批评了吃人的封建社会制度外，也还批评了“拿来主义”。2018年8月16日也是一个难忘的日子，因为爆发了堪比“汉芯造假”事件的<a href="https://www.oschina.net/news/99023/redcore-ceo-respond" target="_blank">“红芯浏览器造假”事件</a>，拿来主义在百年之后的今日依然存在。</p><p>有媒体和网友称，红芯浏览器其实是一款打着“打破美国垄断的、自主可控的、属于中国人的浏览器”旗号的套壳浏览器，内核是谷歌公司的开源内核Chromium ，安装包解析文件中存在大量谷歌浏览器的文件，甚至还有谷歌浏览器的logo。一石激起千层浪，此事件一出便把红芯浏览器和浏览器本身都推到风口浪尖，引发全民大讨论。</p><p>浏览器是计算机中最基础的软件之一，无论是对普通大众还是互联网企业、国家，都具有重要的战略意义。市场上公认的具有自主核心的浏览器有谷歌的chrome浏览器、微软的IE浏览器、网景的Firefox（火狐）浏览器、苹果的Safari浏览器和Opera（欧朋）浏览器。目前市场占有率较大的是谷歌浏览器、IE浏览器和火狐浏览器，国内份额较大的360浏览器、QQ浏览器和UC浏览器都是基于火狐浏览器和谷歌浏览器内核再加以量身定制。</p><h3><strong>国产浏览器的尴尬现状</strong></h3><p>今年中国不仅展现了缺“芯”之痛，“红芯”造假事件又揭示了中国企业在浏览器领域也是处在无核心技术、无发言权、无公信力的“三无”状态。</p><p>无核心技术。众所周知，浏览器内核（渲染）是一款浏览器的核心，掌握了浏览器内核技术就是掌握浏览器的核心技术。当前国内互联网科技公司已经基本掌握浏览器的技术，但是在浏览器内核技术方面还是国外五大浏览器占有绝对优势，或是拥有自己的浏览器内核或是拥有跟其他公司联合开发的浏览器内核，全球都在使用其技术，而国产浏览器目前还没有自己的浏览器内核，缺乏浏览器核心技术，只能用国外的内核在加以修改。有第三方报告称，拥有4亿用户的360浏览器是2017年国产浏览器使用人数最多的浏览器，可大名鼎鼎的360浏览器采用的也是谷歌开源Chromium 63内核，市场份额第一的浏览器尚且如此，更何况其他国产浏览器呢？这也从侧面表现出中国浏览器无核心技术的尴尬局面。</p><p>无发言权。国产浏览器在浏览器领域的发言权极小，决定发言权大小的关键因素还是市场份额的多少，显然国产浏览器在这方面不具有优势。市场份额与国外浏览器相比劣势十分明显，国家互联网应急中心在2018年第一季度调差报告数据显示，PC端的浏览器中，Chrome浏览器占比最高，为38.15%，E浏览器占比35.86%，Firefox浏览器占比8.28%，三款浏览器共占据82.29%的市场份额，而国产浏览器份额最高的是QQ浏览器仅占3%，国产浏览器市场占有率占比不到10%。市场份额占比小，用户少，间接导致国产浏览器在浏览器领域丧失发言权。</p><p>无公信力。国产浏览器选择“拿来主义”时就已注定与公信力无缘，“红芯浏览器造假”事件后，红芯时代非但不承认错误，反而以“站在巨人的肩膀上去做创新”的理由搪塞大众，这就将本就公信力薄弱的国产浏览器的推下失信的万丈深渊，使国产浏览器进一步丧失公信力。</p><h3><strong>四座大山阻碍国产浏览器的前行之路</strong></h3><p>泱泱大国，先是缺“心”（芯片），再是缺“魂”（操作系统），现如今又爆出在浏览器领域依然是三无状态，造成泱泱大国在浏览器领域落后的原因还是中国在web标准、资金和环境等方面存在问题，才导致浏览器落后。</p><p><strong>其一，起步较晚，没有参与制定标准。</strong>在“红芯造假”事件发生后，各方都给出了自己的见解，其中360公司发表题为《中国为什么没有自主研发的浏览器内核？》的文章称中国没有自主浏览器的一重要原因就是我们国家发展晚，错过HTML4制定标准的时代。360公司说得没错，国外浏览器的发展要追溯到上世纪90年代，而国产浏览器的起步则是在1999年，起步晚了近10年之久。而HTML4的许多标准在99年以前就已经定下来，浏览器运行的web网页等文件又特别注重标准，国产浏览器进入浏览器领域时间晚，想要分一杯羹就得基于已有的技术和标准去做事情，这与通迅行业的2G/3G标准如出一辙，这是既定事实造成的门槛。</p><p><strong>其二，浏览器开发成本高。</strong>浏览器的研发和芯片一样，都是需要大量的人力物力投入，而且还是个耗费时间的工程，参与的企业面临极大风险，中国目前企业没有任何一家能够单独完成浏览器的研发。谷歌浏览器的背后是市值8222亿美元的谷歌公司，IE浏览器背后的市值8060亿美元微软公司，而中国市值最高的科技公司是腾讯公司，市值为4500亿美元，差距之大不是一朝一夕能够弥补的。就拿目前市场占有率最大的Chrome浏览器为例，谷歌最少时也调动超过600个硅谷的程序员集中力量去开发出Chromium内核的浏览，从2008年至今也花了10年。按硅谷程序员25万美金/年算，一年研发工资近3亿美金，10年加上工资上涨和其他开支总支出超过18亿美金的研发成本，浩大的研发投入让国产浏览器的研发只能望而却步。</p><p><strong>其三，重视程度不够。</strong>一方面是因为市场上有相对成熟的开源浏览器核心可以使用，出于“拿来主义”精神，加之从0到1的研发投入过于巨大，导致国产浏览器均忽略对浏览器内核的研发；另一方面是因为浏览器本身带来的经济效益并不是太高，采取“拿来主义”魔改开源浏览器内核不但能降低开发成本，还能快速抢占市场，种种原因导致开发具有自主知识产权的国产浏览器一直被忽略。</p><p>除此之外，浏览器内核的开发难度大，也是导致国产浏览器落后的重要原因。以微软IE浏览器为例，微软在开发IE 浏览器时，共使用了2400万行代码，几乎接近半个操作系统的规模，不仅如此微软还动用了硅谷近千人的工程师才开发出来，可想而知浏览器从0到1的开发难度之大，而国产浏览器本就缺“金”少“人”，再加上如此大开发难度，就造成了今天这种国产“套壳”浏览器的诞生。</p><h3><strong>三个维度助力国产浏览器砥砺前行</strong></h3><p>任何一个产品的发展都离不开“人才、资金、用户”三要素的支撑，浏览器的发展也是这样，国产浏览器想要获得更好的发展也要从“人才、资金、用户”三要素入手，方可持续健康发展。</p><p>首先，引进和培养人才。人是一切产品的核心，要开发一个产品离不开人才的支持，开发完全具有自主知识产权的国产浏览器也离不开人才的支持。要解决人才短缺问题可从引进人才和培养人才两方面入手。引进国际尖端人才可缓解人才短缺的局面，亦可为中国带来国外先进的技术和丰富的开发经验，让中国浏览器与国际接轨。培养人才能为浏览器的研发提供源源不断的新鲜血液，为国产浏览器持续健康发展保驾护航。</p><p>其次，“集中力量办大事”，浏览器的研发需要大量的资金支持，还要求资金持续投入，单个企业难以达成，这时就可以通过“集中力量办大事”的思路解决资金不足的问题。一是通过企业和政府机构联合开发，给予政策和资金方面的扶持，为企业研发浏览器注入力量；二是通过多个企业合作，组成研发联盟共同出资、获利和分担风险，这样也能解决研发具有自主知识产权的国产浏览器资金问题。</p><p>最后，积极创新以提高用户体验。浏览器的最终目的和归宿都是为普通用户提供服务，那么国产浏览器要发展也绕不开用户，只有提高用户体验才能得到用户的认可，才能促进国产浏览器的发展。创新是提高用户体验的最佳途径，创新不仅仅体现在浏览器特色小功能、交互模式和UI上面，这些功能用户可通过浏览器拓展接口接入自己想要的功能，微创新不足以提高用户体验，要通过创新让浏览器具备“快”、“小”、“强”、“安全”四点要素，才能真正提高用户体验，让国产浏览器在浏览器领域立足，具有自己的发言权。</p><h3><strong>小结</strong></h3><p>目前，国产浏览器不仅仅需要弥补技术上的不足，更需要增加一种“不将就”的情怀和公信力。因为国产浏览器的健康发展关系到个人、企业和国家的信息安全，所以国产浏览器更应该掌握核心技术，从0到1，从无到有做大做强，为中国互联网甚至是国家的发展做出应有贡献。</p><p>来源：<a data-cke-saved-href="http://www.lanjingtmt.com/news/detail/38251.shtml" href="http://www.lanjingtmt.com/news/detail/38251.shtml" target="_blank">蓝鲸TMT</a>&nbsp;作者：刘旷</p>

rss_title: 开源中国社区最新新闻
title: OSChina 周二乱弹 —— 我还是选择梦游吧

description: <p>万维网之父 Tim Berners-Lee 爵士对今天的中心化 Web 非常不满，他想要<a data-cke-saved-href="https://tech.slashdot.org/story/18/09/30/1122238/tim-berners-lee-announces-solid-an-open-source-project-which-would-aim-to-decentralize-the-web" href="https://tech.slashdot.org/story/18/09/30/1122238/tim-berners-lee-announces-solid-an-open-source-project-which-would-aim-to-decentralize-the-web" target="_blank">拯救互联网</a>，方法是重新去中心化。他<a data-cke-saved-href="https://www.inrupt.com/blog/one-small-step-for-the-web" href="https://www.inrupt.com/blog/one-small-step-for-the-web" target="_blank">正式宣布了</a>新的开源去中心化平台&nbsp;<a data-cke-saved-href="https://solid.inrupt.com/" href="https://solid.inrupt.com/" target="_blank">Solid</a>&nbsp;，<a data-cke-saved-href="https://github.com/solid" href="https://github.com/solid" target="_blank">源代码</a>发布在 GitHub 上。<a data-cke-saved-href="https://github.com/solid" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/solid"></a></p><p>Solid 设计让用户能控制他们在 Web 上产生的数据和内容，能选择数据如何被使用。Solid 的核心是个人数据存储系统 Solid POD，你在网上产生的所有数据都储存在 Solid POD 中，如你的联系人，你的照片和评论， 用户可选择将 Solid POD 储存在自己家中的计算机上，或挑选的网上 Solid POD 供应商（比如 Berners-Lee 创办的 Inrupt），你的所有数据都控制在自己手中，可以自由的添加或删除数据，授予权限给他人或应用来读取或写入部分 Solid POD 数据，不需要同步，因为你的数据一直伴随着你。这个平台需要开发者支持才能真正产生效果，很难想象中心化的平台会支持这个无法控制数据的去中心化平台。</p><p>以下为&nbsp;Tim Berners-Lee 发布的博文文章，<a data-cke-saved-href="https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MjM5MzM3NjM4MA==&amp;mid=2654693946&amp;idx=1&amp;sn=dfd35b2458d644fdb4ee1fd2bcd32fe8&amp;chksm=bd583b298a2fb23fbf9b047fa679115dd3216b925294ae30cde07d889adf0b0d0cd24fdc2acb&amp;mpshare=1&amp;scene=1&amp;srcid=1002Fvtbz7LJeCucvdqZLxx0#rd" target="_blank" href="https://mp.weixin.qq.com/s?__biz=MjM5MzM3NjM4MA==&mid=2654693946&idx=1&sn=dfd35b2458d644fdb4ee1fd2bcd32fe8&chksm=bd583b298a2fb23fbf9b047fa679115dd3216b925294ae30cde07d889adf0b0d0cd24fdc2acb&mpshare=1&scene=1&srcid=1002Fvtbz7LJeCucvdqZLxx0#rd">中文版由云头条编译</a>：<br/></p><h3><strong>向Web迈出一小步......</strong><br/></h3><p>我一直认为Web是所有人的。这就是为什么我和其他人在竭力保护Web。我们设法带来的变化已创造了一个更美好、更连通的世界。尽管我们取得了种种好处，但Web已渐渐变成充斥着不公平和分裂的引擎，被用来牟取私利的强大力量所左右。</p><p>今天，我认为我们已到了一个关键的临界点，往好的方向转变的强大变革是可能的，也是必要的。<br/></p><p>这就是为什么我近年来一直与麻省理工学院（MIT）及其他组织的一些人合作开发Solid，这是一个开源项目，旨在将权力和自由重新交给Web上的每个人。<br/></p><p>Solid改变了当前的模式：用户必须将个人数据交给数字巨头以换取所谓的价值。正如我们发现的那样，这不符合我们的最佳利益。Solid体现了我们在改善Web以便恢复平衡，以一种全新的方让我们每个人能够全面控制数据，无论数据是不是个人数据。<br/></p><p>Solid是使用现有Web构建的平台。它让每个用户可以选择数据存储在何处、哪些特定的人员和人群可以访问选定的数据以及使用哪些应用程序。它让你、你的家人和同事可以与任何人链接和共享数据。它让人们可以同时使用不同的应用程序查看同样的数据。<br/></p><p>Solid为创造力、解决问题和商业带来了大好机会。它将让个人、开发者和公司企业能够以全新的方式来构想、构建和发掘创新的、可信的、有益的应用程序和服务。我看到了诸多商机，包括Solid应用程序和Solid数据存储。<br/></p><p><strong>数据应该帮助你</strong><br/></p><p>Solid遵循“通过数据帮助个人”这个原则，我们认为这个原则是Web下一个时代成功的基础。我们认为数据应该帮助我们每个人。<br/></p><p>设想一下：如果你目前的所有应用程序彼此联系，协作并构想丰富和简化你个人生活和业务目标的方法将会怎样？这就是Solid应用程序有望带来的那种创新、智能和创造力。<br/></p><p>有了Solid，你个人对数据拥有极大的权力和自由：由你决定哪些应用程序可以访问它。<br/></p><p><strong>注入动力</strong><br/></p><p>我在2009年说过：“我们还没看到我当初设想的Web。”那是由于人们将Web仅仅用于文档，而不是用于一台庞大联网计算机的数据。从那时起，我们看到了一波开放数据，但不是一波读写数据。比如说，许多开放的政府数据是通过单向管道生成的，所以我们只能查看。有了Solid，Web成了一个读写Web，用户可以在其中交互、创新、协作和共享。<br/></p><p>不过与此同时，出现了一波要求变革的呼声。人们希望有一个可以信任的Web。人们希望应用程序帮助他们做想要做和需要做的事情，又不监视他，没有以买这买那的要求让人们分心这个不可告人的动机的应用程序。人们将掏钱购买这种质量和保证。比如说，如今人们在Dropbox之类的网站掏钱购买存储空间。现在需要Solid以及它将提供的不一样的有益方法。<br/></p><p>构建新的Solid平台、促进广泛采用要付出巨大的努力，但我认为我们有足够的精力将世界带到一个新的转折点。<br/></p><p>因此，我向MIT休了假，减少了在万维网联盟（W3C）的日常工作，创办了一家名为inrupt的公司，我将非常直接地负责引导Web的下一个阶段。iinrupt将成为让Solid得以蓬勃发展起来的基础设施。它的使命是提供商业力量和生态系统，有助于保护基于Solid的新Web的完整性和质量。<br/></p><p>开源项目从一家资源充足的公司的贡献中获益匪浅，这样的例子有好多。虽然开源社区提供了首创精神和创新根源，但日常的Web用户和公司企业却常常向另外提供技术支持和重要的附属商业服务的商业实体寻求应用程序和服务。<br/></p><p>我认为同样这个模式对于Solid的成功至关重要。inrupt的成功与Solid的成功完全休戚相关。我的合伙人和inrupt联合创始人是约翰•布鲁斯（John Bruce），他是一位经验丰富的商业领袖，具备丰富的技能，能够实现我对Solid怀有的愿景。我们同样热衷于打造一个更美好、更平衡的Web。<br/></p><p>Solid和inrupt将共同提供有益于每个Web用户的新体验，这在今天的Web上是不可能的。到时，个人、开发者以及公司企业创建和发掘创新的、丰富生活和业务的应用程序和服务。到时我们将拥有用于存储、保护和管理个人数据的可信服务。<br/></p><p>对于Web的这下一个时代我非常乐观。<br/></p><p>我仍将担任W3C、Web基金会和开放数据研究所的创始人兼董事，而这些组织是保护过去的Web和现在的Web的重要组成部分。Inrupt是W3C的成员，使用许多现有标准，是这个制定标准的社区的一部分。Web基金会倡导数据权利，其使命是促进一个有益于人类的自由开放的Web。而开放数据研究所在尊重隐私的同时，确保数据尽可能开放，这非常重要。我身兼数职，我在每个岗位上工作时，总是竭力以符合该组织的利益来行事。<br/></p><p>眼下是令人激动的时期。我将致力于为Solid指导发展方向，并规划未来治理。Inrupt将做很多事情：它的首要任务是打造Solid生态系统。凭借正确的价值观和基本的企业基础设施，我们将建造有利于每个人的有益系统。<br/></p><p>未来仍然比过去美好得多。<br/></p><p>博客原文：<a data-cke-saved-href="https://www.inrupt.com/blog/one-small-step-for-the-web" target="_blank" href="https://www.inrupt.com/blog/one-small-step-for-the-web">https://www.inrupt.com/blog/one-small-step-for-the-web</a></p>

title: 万维网之父 Tim Berners-Lee 开源去中心化平台 Solid

description: <p>Debian 开发者最近一直在讨论一个不太正统的想法 ——&nbsp;在他们的年度&nbsp;DebConf 开发者大会上，嘉宾在发表演讲后不允许向其提问，或要求他们回答。据说，这种禁止问答的想法来自 Python 开发者大会的政策，他们的会议也禁止在演讲后向嘉宾提问/回答，目的是帮助新人。<br/></p><p>Debian 开发者大都拒绝了在 DebConf 大会上发表演讲后不允许进行 Q&amp;A 的想法，因为开发者/贡献者的年度聚会是关于协作和为这个领先的 Linux 发行版培养新的想法。禁止 Q&amp;A 这个想法是由 Debian 项目负责人 Chris Lamb 提出的，他在看到 PyCascades Python 大会上演讲完明确禁止进行问答环节后，发起了对这个想法的讨论。<br/></p><p>这个在太平洋西北地区举办的年度 Python 大会决定完全禁止 Q&amp;A 环节，以“让它成为对新演讲者更友好的第一个环境”。<br/></p><p><img alt="" data-cke-saved-src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/97d4c16387ec5f561ade46d37764949cba0.jpg" src="https://oscimg.oschina.net/oscnet/97d4c16387ec5f561ade46d37764949cba0.jpg"/><br/></p><p>这个想法在很大程度上被 Debian 开发者所拒绝，并且看起来不会有足够的动力应用于未来的 DebConf 大会上。虽然有一些开发者支持这个想法，包括一些演讲者 —— 其中英语不是他们的母语，因此希望不必处理问答，而其他人则建议这个政策也许可以由演讲者在每个演示文稿的基础上决定。<br/></p><p>有关这想法的讨论，可点此查看(<a data-cke-saved-href="https://lists.debian.org/debconf-discuss/2018/09/msg00001.html" href="https://lists.debian.org/debconf-discuss/2018/09/msg00001.html">debconf-discuss</a>)，Chris Lamb 在他的<a data-cke-saved-href="https://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2018/09/msg00005.html" target="_blank" href="https://lists.debian.org/debian-devel-announce/2018/09/msg00005.html">每月 Debian 项目负责人笔记</a>中也提到了这件事。</p>

title: Debian 开发者商榷在会议上不允许进行问答环节的想法​​​​​​​

description: <p>San 3.6.10 已发布，此次更新内容如下：</p><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p>【优化】- 对 polyfill 侵入 Object prototype 的环境进行判断处理</p></li><li><p>【优化】- 组件数据绑定将 kabab 转换成 camel 形式时，兼容原名称包含大写字母</p></li><li><p>【bug修复】- 声明 button 的 type 属性时，在低版本 ie 下有运行错误，无法绘制</p></li></ul><p>San 是百度开源的一个 MVVM 的组件框架。它体积小巧（12.6K），兼容性好（IE6），性能卓越，是一个可靠、可依赖的实现响应式用户界面的解决方案。</p><p>San 通过声明式的类 HTML 视图模板，在支持所有原生 HTML 的语法特性外，还支持了数据到视图的绑定指令、业务开发中最常使用的分支、循环指令等，在保持良好的易用性基础上，由框架完成基于字符串的模板解析，并构建出视图层的&nbsp;节点关系树，通过高性能的视图引擎快速生成 UI 视图。San 中定义的数据会被封装，使得当数据发生有效变更时通知 San 组件，San 组件依赖模板编译阶段生成的节点关系树，确定需要变更的最小视图，进而完成视图的异步更新，保证了视图更新的高效性。</p><p>下载地址：</p><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p><a data-cke-saved-href="https://github.com/baidu/san/archive/3.6.10.zip" href="https://github.com/baidu/san/archive/3.6.10.zip">Source code(zip)</a></p></li><li><p><a data-cke-saved-href="https://github.com/baidu/san/archive/3.6.10.tar.gz" href="https://github.com/baidu/san/archive/3.6.10.tar.gz">Source code(tar.gz)</a></p></li></ul>
rss_title: 开源中国社区最新新闻
title: San 3.6.10 发布，百度开源的 MVVM 组件框架

description: <p>Ant Design 3.9.4 已发布，Ant Design 是蚂蚁金服开发和正在使用的一套企业级前端设计语言和基于 React 的前端框架实现。</p><p>该版本的更新内容主要是 bug 修复，具体如下：</p><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2"><li><p>更新了<a data-cke-saved-href="https://ant.design/docs/spec/icon-cn" href="https://ant.design/docs/spec/icon-cn">图标</a>和<a data-cke-saved-href="https://ant.design/docs/spec/motion-cn" href="https://ant.design/docs/spec/motion-cn">动效</a>两篇设计指引。</p></li><li><p>Upload 组件新增&nbsp;<code>openFileDialogOnClick</code>&nbsp;属性，用于设置点击组件时是否打开上传对话框。<a href="https://github.com/hengkx">@hengkx</a></p></li><li><p>InputNumber 组件新增&nbsp;<code>decilamSeparator</code>&nbsp;属性，用于设置自定义的小数点。<a href="https://github.com/amedora">@amedora</a></p></li><li><p>TreeSelect 组件新增&nbsp;<code>treeExpandedKeys</code>&nbsp;和&nbsp;<code>onTreeExpand</code>&nbsp;属性，用于控制树的展开收起。<a data-cke-saved-href="https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/12145" href="https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/12145">#12145</a></p></li><li><p>Transfer</p></li><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2" style="list-style-type: square;"><li><p>新增&nbsp;<code>disabled</code>&nbsp;属性。<a data-cke-saved-href="https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/12066" square;"><li><p>新增&nbsp;<code>autoFocusButton</code>&nbsp;属性，用于指定 Modal 打开时自动获取焦点的按钮。<a data-cke-saved-href="https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/pull/11756" href="https://github.com/Whoaa512">@Whoaa512</a></p></li></ul><li><p>Table</p></li><ul class=" list-paddingleft-2" style="list-style-type: href="https://github.com/ant-design/ant-design/issues/11246">#11246</a></p></li><li><p><code>onChange</code>&nbsp;属性新增第四个参数&nbsp;<code>extra</code>，用于获取当前显示的筛选后的数据。<a 新增&nbsp;<code>icon</code>&nbsp;属性，用户设置自定义图标。例子：<a data-cke-saved-href="https://ant.design/components/alert-cn/#components-alert-demo-custom-icon"
